content.text: Melange, referred to throughout the Imperium as 'the spice,' remains the most valuable substance known to mankind. This Spacing Guild restricted document contains essential information for those with appropriate clearance.

The geriatric properties of the spice extend human life beyond standard projections. Guild Navigators achieve limited prescience through spice saturation. Withdrawal symptoms are consistently fatal. Taste profile: cinnamon with distinctive resonances. Addiction is immediate and irreversible.

items: Life extension (Factor X4-X7)
Consciousness expansion (Mentats grade 3)
Guild Navigator space-folding catalyst (Classified)
Eyes of Ibad manifestation in heavy users
Physiological dependency (Classification: Extreme)

content.text: Contrary to popular Imperial knowledge, our Fremen sources confirm the spice cycle begins with sandtrout excretions interacting with water beneath Arrakis' surface. This mixture undergoes pressure transformations before being exposed to the atmosphere in pre-spice masses.
The spice must flow. - Emperor Shaddam IV, address to the Landsraad

Arrakis, designated Imperial Fief and CHOAM directorship under House Harkonnen, third planet of Canopus. Now under transition to House Atreides by Imperial decree. Primary export: Melange. Classification: Desert Planet.

Surface conditions: 22% livable by Imperial standards. Atmospheric composition within human tolerance. Moisture reclamation mandatory. Surface temperatures exceed 350° standard during daylight in deep desert regions. No recorded precipitation outside polar regions. Terrain classification: 75% erg, 20% rock outcroppings, 5% inhabitable.

items: Fremen (Unregistered population estimates classified - Imperial Census disputed)
Shai-Hulud (Classification: Protected Resource - Spacing Guild Directive)
Desert ecosystem variants (Imperial Ecological Survey SUPP-R7-55)

content.text: Sole source of melange in the Imperium. CHOAM profit margins exceed 10,000% on raw spice. Guild transport fees require 6% of all harvested spice. Imperial taxation rights: 27% of gross production. Landsraad security assessment: Critical Resource.
Arrakis teaches the attitude of the knife — chopping off what's incomplete and saying: 'Now, it's complete because it's ended here.' - Glossary, Muad'Dib Cultural Studies

commands.name: /houses
commands.title: The Great Houses of the Imperium

content.text: The Padishah Empire maintains balance through the tripartite power structure of Emperor, Landsraad, and CHOAM. This official directory outlines the Major and Minor Houses holding planetary fiefs by Imperial decree.

items: House Corrino - Imperial House, rulers from Kaitain
House Atreides - Caladan, now Arrakis
House Harkonnen - Giedi Prime
House Richese - Industrial power
House Ix - Technological innovation
House Fenring - Imperial proxies

content.text: The Landsraad Council represents 73 Great Houses and 31 Minor Houses with voting rights. CHOAM directorships align with planetary holdings and spice quotas. The Great Convention prohibits atomic weapons against human targets. Kanly and vendetta protocols regulated through Guild arbitration.
A House that cannot control its own planet is not a Great House. - Landsraad Convention, First Sitting

House Harkonnen, Major House of the Landsraad. Planetary fief: Giedi Prime. Previous administrators of Arrakis for 80 standard years. Known for industrial efficiency and resource extraction expertise.

Baron Vladimir Harkonnen, Head of House. Na-Baron Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen, designated heir. Mentat Piter de Vries, chief strategist. Captain of Guard Iakin Nefud. Maintains significant Sardaukar support through Imperial arrangement.

items: 22 legions of house troops (Imperial quality rating: moderate)
Significant CHOAM holdings (primarily in spice derivatives)
Giedi Prime industrial capacity (weapons manufacturing restricted by convention)
Slave population: classified (Landsraad inquiry pending)

content.text: Ancestral feud with House Atreides dates to the Battle of Corrin. Recent execution of Glossu Rabban on Arrakis has destabilized Harkonnen operations in the region. Security recommendation: monitor all Harkonnen-Atreides interactions as potentially hostile.
My dear Emperor, I but serve as you command, as any loyal subject would. - Baron Vladimir Harkonnen, Imperial Court Transcript

House Atreides, Major House of the Landsraad. Ancestral fief: Caladan. Current assignment: Arrakis. Lineage traces to ancient House of Atreus. Known for water-rich holdings and exceptional military training programs.

Duke Leto Atreides, Head of House. Heir: Paul Atreides. Lady Jessica (Bene Gesserit-trained). Mentat Thufir Hawat, Master of Assassins. Swordmaster Duncan Idaho. Warmaster Gurney Halleck. Exceptional loyalty indicators in household staff and military.

items: House troops: 10 legions (Imperial quality rating: excellent)
Fighter squadrons with ornithopter specialists
Elite guard trained in Bene Gesserit nerve control methods
Atreides battle language (classified communication system)
Freighter fleet with military conversion capability

content.text: Rising popularity in the Landsraad poses potential threat to Imperial stability. Duke Leto's charismatic leadership attracts allies among the Houses. Recommendation: Monitor carefully for signs of coalition-building against Imperial interests.
I serve only one master: the Imperium. - Duke Leto Atreides, Landsraad Congress

ᚔ THIS DOCUMENT RESTRICTED BY FREMEN COUNCIL ᚔ
Muad'Dib, the desert mouse that leaps. He who knows the ways of the desert shall survive. The name taken by Paul Atreides among the Fremen, as prophesied by the Missionaria Protectiva.

The desert mouse teaches survival through its water-conservative biology. It hides during heat and emerges in coolness. It navigates by the light of the second moon of Arrakis, which bears the same name. To take this name is to claim understanding of desert ways.

items: Voice from the Outer World
Son of a Bene Gesserit
The Lisan al-Gaib who shall lead us to paradise
He who can be many places at once
The one who transforms the waters of life

content.text: Sietch Tabr acknowledges the name by the rites of water and soil. The Council of Naibs has confirmed the succession through combat trial. The Water of Life has been transformed. The prophecy is fulfilled.
I am Muad'Dib, who shows the Golden Path. - From the Collected Sayings

Shai-Hulud, revered among the Fremen as the Maker. Known to Imperial Planetology as Geonemotodium arraknis. The great sandworm of Arrakis is the essential link in the spice cycle and the largest organism known to exist in the Imperium.

Length: Specimens exceeding 400 meters recorded. Morphology: Segmented annelid with diamond-patterned musculature. Sensory apparatus detects rhythmic vibrations across vast distances. Life cycle connected to sandtrout (early phase) and spice production as a metabolic byproduct.

items: Territorial response to rhythmic vibrations
Emerges to consume vibration sources and all surrounding material
Capable of swallowing entire spice harvesters
Cannot cross open water (toxic to organism)
Lifespan estimated at 4,500 standard years (unverified)

content.text: Fremen have developed hooks and techniques for riding emerged worms as transportation. Religious significance in native culture. Teeth collected as sacred objects ('crysknives'). The Maker's presence is invoked in all major tribal rituals.
God created Arrakis to train the faithful. - Fremen saying

CLASSIFICATION: IMPERIAL EYES ONLY
Fremen: Indigenous human population of Arrakis. Origins traced to Zensunni wanderers. Estimated population: officially 5 million (actual numbers likely significantly higher). Extremely adapted to desert conditions and water conservation.

Organized in tribal units called sietches, hidden in rock outcroppings. Leadership through combat prowess and water stewardship. Naib tribal leaders form a loose confederation. Water discipline forms the foundation of all social contracts. Death rites recover water for the tribe.

items: Desert-adapted warriors with exceptional hand-to-hand combat skills
Stillsuit technology enabling extended desert survival
Worm-riding capabilities providing rapid deployment
Extensive tunnel and cave networks with hidden water caches
Fanatical religious motivation

content.text: Religious practices center on water conservation and prophetic traditions (likely Bene Gesserit Missionaria Protectiva implantation). Economic activity includes spice mining and smuggling operations. The extent of their water caches suggests centuries of systematic accumulation toward planetary transformation.
A man's flesh is his own; the water belongs to the tribe. - Fremen saying

The Bene Gesserit Sisterhood, formally recognized as a school for female education. Actual function: selective breeding program spanning thousands of generations, political advisors, and genetic memory repositories. Headquarters on Wallach IX.

Practitioners master the Voice (neurolinguistic command), muscle-mind techniques (prana-bindu), truthsaying, and subtle poison immunities. Reverend Mothers possess access to genetic memory of female ancestry through spice agony ritual. Breeding program controlled through meticulous genetic record-keeping.

items: Placement of trained Sisters as wives and concubines to Great Houses
Missionaria Protectiva (religious manipulation on primitive worlds)
Manipulation of bloodlines toward genetic goals
Training of Mentats and advisors
Secretive agreements with Spacing Guild and CHOAM

content.text: Evidence suggests culmination of breeding program nearing completion. Subject Paul Atreides potentially unplanned variable in multi-millennia genetic program. Mother Superior Mohiam has taken unusual interest in House Atreides. Recommend increased surveillance of all Bene Gesserit movements.
We sift people to find the humans. - Bene Gesserit saying

The ornithopter ('thopter) represents the primary atmospheric transport technology throughout the Imperium. These flapping-wing aircraft combine mechanical efficiency with remarkable adaptability to diverse planetary conditions, from the dense atmospheres of Caladan to the harsh thermals of Arrakis.

Standard military configurations utilize suspensor-enhanced wing assemblies with articulated feathering capabilities. Power plant: Holtzman energy converter with secondary combustion backup. Maximum atmospheric ceiling varies by planetary conditions. Desert-adapted variants include dust filters and enhanced cooling systems.

House militaries employ ornithopters as rapid deployment vehicles, reconnaissance platforms, and limited ground support. The distinctive wing motion offers superior maneuverability in complex terrain where jet propulsion proves inefficient. Arrakis operations require specialized modifications to prevent sand ingestion and manage extreme temperature variations.

items: Atreides Military Pattern (enhanced stabilization systems)
Harkonnen Heavy Assault Variant (weapons capacity upgraded)
Guild Survey Model (extended range capabilities)
Imperial Courier (highest speed classification)
Smuggler Modified (sensor dampening, questionable legality)

content.text: A wise commander knows that reliable transport often determines battlefield supremacy more than weaponry. - Thufir Hawat, Atreides Master of Assassins

Following the Butlerian Jihad and the Great Convention's proscription against thinking machines, the Order of Mentats emerged as human computers trained to replace computational functions. These mathematical prodigies undergo extensive conditioning to achieve hyper-logical cognitive processing capabilities.

Mentat training begins in childhood with mental mathematics and progresses through mnemonic intensification. The distinctive ruby stain on the lips indicates sapho juice addiction, the mental enhancement stimulant essential to their computational abilities. Full Mentats require minimum fifteen standard years of conditioning.

Standard Mentats serve administrative functions throughout the Imperium. Mentat-Assassins combine computational abilities with physical combat training. Master Mentats achieve intuitive leaps beyond standard logical progression. Twisted Mentats (often Harkonnen-trained) sacrifice mental stability for processing speed.

items: Thufir Hawat - Atreides Master of Assassins
Piter de Vries - Harkonnen Twisted Mentat
Bellonda - Bene Gesserit Mentat
Miles Teg - Mentat-Bashar (historical figure)
Duncan Idaho - Partial Mentat training (unconfirmed)

content.text: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. - Mentat mantra

The Sardaukar Corps represents the Emperor's fanatically loyal terror troops raised on the prison planet Salusa Secundus. Combat effectiveness rating exceeds that of any Great House forces by a factor of ten to one. Total strength estimated at five million combat-ready troops with reserve capabilities classified.

items: Environmental conditioning in Salusa Secundus' harsh conditions
Survival rate of training: 3 in 10 recruits
Intensive indoctrination to Imperial philosophy
Death-alternative discipline structure
Specialized combat techniques restricted by Imperial decree

content.text: Operational deployment occurs only under direct Imperial authority. Sardaukar officers occasionally embedded with House forces as observers and political officers. Detection countermeasures include non-standard uniforms when operating covertly among Great House conflicts.

The combat supremacy of Sardaukar forces maintains the Imperial balance of power against combined House resistance. Recent performance metrics suggest slight degradation in effectiveness over past two generations. Failure to defeat Fremen irregulars on Arrakis represents first significant operational setback.
They have never known defeat. Thus, they cannot recognize it when it arrives. - Count Fenring, private correspondence to Emperor Shaddam IV

The stillsuit represents the pinnacle of Fremen desert survival technology. This full-body distillation system reclaims body moisture with 95% efficiency, allowing extended deep desert excursions without external water sources. Standard stillsuits can maintain operational water balance for up to three weeks under optimal conditions.

Multiple filtration layers process perspiration, urine, and feces into potable water through mechanical pumping powered by body movement. Nose plugs recapture exhaled moisture, and collection pouches at wrists and ankles utilize osmotic properties to extract maximum hydration. The outer layer provides thermal regulation and limited protection against sandstorm abrasion.

items: Skin layer must maintain negative contact at all motility points
Forehead catch-pockets positioned precisely at sweat collection points
Bootseals verified for integrity before desert crossing
Waist filters checked for desert dust accumulation
Pumping rate adjusted to metabolic expenditure expectations

content.text: Sietch stillsuits prioritize efficiency over mobility for elderly and children. Fremen deathstills process corpses for water reclamation. Smuggler variants sacrifice longevity for concealment. Imperial copies rarely exceed 70% efficiency due to manufacturing compromises and lack of generational knowledge.
Your stillsuit is fitted desert fashion. Who taught you to do that? - Stilgar to Paul Atreides

BENE GESSERIT INTERNAL DOCUMENT - HIGHEST CLASSIFICATION
The gom jabbar—"the high-handed enemy"—serves as the ultimate test of human potential versus animal instinct. This poison needle device, utilized exclusively by Bene Gesserit Reverend Mothers, delivers instantaneous death when properly administered.

The subject places their hand inside a nerve induction box simulating progressive pain while a gom jabbar is positioned at their neck. Withdrawal from the box triggers immediate administration of the poison. Survival requires conscious override of survival instinct—the fundamental separation between human and animal consciousness.

items: Meta-cyanide base with neurological accelerants
Praxil enhancers for pain amplification
Modified derivative of chaumas nectar
Delivery mechanism: 0.01mm crystalline needle
No known antivenin or countermeasure

content.text: Historical utilization data indicates 22% mortality rate among tested subjects. Testing typically administered during childhood (ages 8-14 standard). Atreides heir Paul represents statistical anomaly in pain threshold and duration tolerance. Reverend Mother Mohiam's test report classified at highest Bene Gesserit restriction.
To endure the pain is to prove your humanity. To succumb is to reveal the animal. - Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam
